item.title: Symbolika poslednej večere
item.description: Večera je na zemi, v čase a priestore. Je prítomných 12 učeníkov. Deň ma 12 hodín. Potom nasleduje ukrižovanie. Ježiš je mimo času a priestoru. Už nie je v sprievode učeníkov, ani nie je na konkrétnom mieste.

item.title: Perfection
item.description: Do you know what goes hand in hand with perfection? It’s boredom! Imagine working hard your entire life for perfection. You improve, then push even harder and improve more. Finally, you become the best. There you are—perfect. You know all the rules of the game, and all the tricks, too. Each game is fixed; you know the winner in advance - it’s you! The first game, the next, and even the last, you know the results beforehand.

item.title: Bad infinity
item.description: Descriptions of modern hell. Inspired by Ted Goia’s 13 Observations on Ritual: Slow traditional culture -> Fast modern culture -> Dopamine culture The smartphone cannot be a ritualistic object. Genuine ritual is always embedded in time and place. Memes are rituals drained of transcendence. The largest companies today are obsessed with generating content in a completely de-ritualized context. Internet businesses feel this void, and try to fill it with pseudo-rituals In an overly digitized world, people embrace with intensity the few remaining ritualistic activities available to them.

item.title: Genesis
item.description: Stvorenie sveta 1 Na počiatku stvoril Boh nebo a zem. 2 Zem bola pustá a prázdna, tma bola nad prahlbinou a Boží duch sa vznášal nad vodami. 3 Boh povedal: „Nech je svetlo!“ A bolo svetlo. 4 Boh videl, že svetlo je dobré, a oddelil svetlo od tmy. 5 Boh nazval svetlo dňom a tmu nazval nocou. Bol večer, bolo ráno, prvý deň. 6 Boh povedal: „Nech je obloha uprostred vôd a nech oddeľuje vody od vôd!

item.title: Game of Life
item.description: Career: Get a life. Learn something and do it well. Become financially independent. If you fail to do so, you even haven’t started to play. Wisdom: Get frustrated with life. Start the search. This is the “wheel of fortune” tarot card. Philosophy. If you fail so, you’ll be trapped in running towards the ephemeral. Death: Die, like Jesus did. Congrats, you made it. Liberation, freedom is yours. If you don’t, you’ll end up like an academic.

item.title: Rýchlo, lacno a kvalitne
item.description: Vraj je možné mať len dve z týchto troch. K čomu to vedie? Rýchlo, lacno a nekvalitne Výsledkom bude “šmejd”, resp. snaha vybehnúť s niekým resp. niečím. Na druhú stranu tento prístup bude budovať inteligenciu niekoho, kto sa oň snaží. A tiež funguje proti inercii - lenivosti. Rýchlosťou človek unikne zemi. Rýchlo, draho a kvalitne Nepozerať sa na cenu a požadovať prvotriedne výsledky buduje sebadôležitosť. Z človeka stane elitista / snob / egoista … indivíduum.

item.title: The Mind of Napoleon
item.description: src There are only two powers in the world – the power of the sword and the spirit…In the long run, the sword is always beaten by the spirit. How can there be a state without any religion? Society cannot exist without inequality of fortune, and inequality of fortune cannot exist without religion In Spinoza, each thought is a step to another thought; in Napoleon, each thought is a step to an action Luck is the ability to exploit accidents.

item.title: Science
item.description: What does “science” actually mean? What does it encompass? Slavic Slovak or Czech word “veda” refers to the ancient Vedas. These are the holy scriptures of ancient India. The name probably means “giving (da) knowledge (ve)”. The Vedas consist of two parts. The first is about the worldly knowledge and the later part (Upanishads) are about the sacred knowledge of the non-changing God. The original meaning refers to the compendium of knowledge known as Vedas.

item.title: Review whole codebase easily
item.description: Recently, a student asked me to review a small project hosted on GitHub. Initially, I assumed I would use the Pull Request/Code Review functionality of GitHub to do so. I found an easy way to perform it on the whole codebase. However, I eventually decided that I wanted to have a broader view, rather than just looking at a small portion of the changes through the Code Review’s microscope. Utilizing an IDE that could visualize the connections in the code and show how things were being used and defined also helped me a lot.

item.title: Slobodná vôľa
item.description: Existuje, či neexistuje? Čo to vlastne je? Slobodná vôľa hovorí, že agent, napr. človek sa môže slobodne rozhodnúť. Teda, že nie je determinovaný, ale sám sebe pánom svojho osudu. Na základe čoho si ale vyberá? Existuje? Aby slobodná vôľa existovala musí platiť, že pri rozhodovaní v presne tej situácii, sa NE-rozhodneme presne rovnako. Lebo ináč by platilo, že voľba je podmienená situáciou a nie v rukách agentom. Situáciou chápem celý stav vesmíru.

item.title: pra-vda: Reflexia inšpirovaná Murlim
item.description: Pravda Čo je pravda? Aby niečo mohlo byť pravdou, nesmie sa to meniť. Ináč by to po zmene prestalo byť pravdou. Takže pravda je to, čo je stále tým istým. Vnímanie Ako funguje vnímanie? Vnímame na základe rozdielu. Vnímame iba veci premenlivé. Nemôžem vnímať veci konštantné, pretože by sme sme stratili rozdiel medzi teraz a vtedy/potom a tu a tam. Všetko by to bolo jedno. Hľadanie pravdy Čo je aktivita? Aktivitou sa snažím docieliť niečoho.
